text:
ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: A
little bit of Trump
lives in every one of us.
That's what's frightening.
[music playing]

CHRIS MOODY: President
Trump has inspired
a legion of impersonators.
- You're in.
You're in, you're in.
- Thank me very much.

CHRIS MOODY: One of
the best fake Trumps

is Anthony Atamanuik,
a comedian who

started playing him
as a joke and took
the act on the road in 2016.

Now, his version of Trump has
a talk show on Comedy Central.

- This television show is
my greatest accomplishment.

CHRIS MOODY: I sat down
with Anthony on set
before the show's premiere.

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: I want
to rob him of his identity.

I want to take his swagger
and his visage of swaggering

masculinity, and I
want to replace it
with this effeminized dowager--

that is distracted,
and not intellectual,

and ineffective, and incapable
of being in the Office.

- I love Russia, I love
Vladimir Putin, great guy.
He's our enemy.
But he's a great guy.
[laughter]

CHRIS MOODY: Anthony
has a dream job,

but it doesn't come
without a little irony.

Here's what he told
me at one of his shows

last year, before
Trump won the election.

- I hope I am a big loser
because personally, I

do not want to play this
guy for the rest of my life.

CHRIS MOODY: And
now, here we are.

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: I would
trade this in a heartbeat,
if he wasn't president.
I would give it--

I would snap my fingers,
and this all went away.

And I'm teaching improv,
but Trump isn't President,
I would be fine with it--
more than fine with it.

I still will only
do this as long
as he is a political figure.

The moment he is not
a political figure,

I will burn the wig in a bucket,
and I will never go back to it.

- I must be doing
something right

because I have a late night
show, and you don't, losers.

And now, I'll take
some questions.

CHRIS MOODY: When
people learn a language,

they often start dreaming in
that other foreign language.

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: Yes.
CHRIS MOODY: Do you dream--

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: As Trump?
CHRIS MOODY: --as Donald Trump?

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: [laughter]
No, I think that would be--

if I dreamt as Donald Trump,
I think I would have to check
myself into a psych clinic.

CHRIS MOODY: Do you
dream of Donald Trump?

ANTHONY ATAMANUIK: I
had two dreams with him.

I had one, where he was
like really far away,
and I just saw him for a second.

And I had a dream with
him two weeks ago,

and it was one of those,
where I was like--
oh, he gets me.
He's hearing me.

It was like that thing
of like, he's hearing me.
He's changing, right?

Which maybe is my
hope for the show.
